thread.title: Edinburgh Oasis fans given urgent deadline as BBC Breakfast star warns 'no guarantee' of tickets
thread.title_full: Edinburgh Oasis fans given urgent deadline as BBC Breakfast star warns 'no guarantee' of tickets

author: news@edinburghlive.co.uk (Jess Phillips, Lee Dalgetty)
title: Edinburgh Oasis fans given urgent deadline as BBC Breakfast star warns 'no guarantee' of tickets
text: [Oasis](https://www.edinburghlive.co.uk/news/edinburgh-news/edinburgh-oasis-presale-tickets-code-29830888) fans looking to nab tickets for the Edinburgh [gigs](https://www.edinburghlive.co.uk/best-in-edinburgh/gigs-clubs/) have been issued an urgent deadline. The Gallagher brothers announced they would be reuniting for a series of gigs in the UK and Ireland, reports the [Daily Express](https://www.express.co.uk/showbiz/tv-radio/1942129/oasis-fans-urgent-ticket-deadline-warning). With fans desperate to get their hands on tickets, [BBC Breakfast](https://www.edinburghlive.co.uk/all-about/bbc) aired a segment advising them how best to do so. Business correspondent Ben Boulos warned Oasis fans it "won't be a simple process". READ MORE - [Edinburgh Oasis fans issued advice for securing tickets from 'seasoned pro'](https://www.edinburghlive.co.uk/news/edinburgh-news/edinburgh-oasis-fans-issued-advice-29835285) READ MORE - [Throwback photos show 'iconic' performance from Oasis at 2009 Edinburgh Murrayfield gig](https://www.edinburghlive.co.uk/news/edinburgh-news/throwback-photos-show-iconic-performance-29834588) He explained: “The general sale starts tomorrow morning at 9am (August 31) and an hour earlier in Ireland. "So set a reminder now!" Ben urged, adding: "But there will be a pre-sale process with access via a ballot.” Ben said: “Now applications to enter that closed on Wednesday night, although huge demand meant a delay in some fans getting confirmation of their entry via an email with a link to click on to verify that they want to join the ballot. "Those emails are still being sent out this morning, and you will need to click the link to confirm your entry by 10am today.” Sign up for [ Edinburgh Live newsletters ](https://www.edinburghlive.co.uk/newsletter-preference-centre/?view=Solus&mailingListId=52589817-5145-4bda-812c-35c36c95fb08&utm_source=solusarticle)for more headlines straight to your inbox Ben went on to tell keen buyers: “People drawn in the ballot will be sent details of the pre-sale by 5pm today, although it’s not yet clear when that starts or how many tickets are available. "It will be a first come, first served basis. So even then there’s no guarantee of getting a ticket!” Ben went on to chat to two Oasis superfans who have seen the band 50 times between them – and one is already planning on attending two dates of the 2025 tour. And in a cheeky exchange with hosts Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty, Ben made it clear he’s had “quite enough” of their antics. Join [ Edinburgh Live's Whatsapp Community here ](https://chat.whatsapp.com/DBFongo3zQS6P8RfPA1ryO) and get the latest news sent straight to your messages Clutching his script in hand, he pretended to read: “It says here, ‘Oasis pun-filled chat with Charlie and Naga’, but I think we’ve had quite enough of that this week already, don’t you?” Naga giggled, but couldn’t resist yet another pun as she said: “Definitely maybe.” Charlie quipped: “Had you actually rehearsed that?” as Naga insisted: “I’m just very quick witted!” Charlie admitted: "It's not a simple process," in regards to booking tickets – as Ben said fans have an "anxious wait" ahead as fans scramble for reunion tickets.
